title: Uprooted, Ep. 3: Failed Dreams and Embassy Breaks
description: The Cuban revolution promised people a better life: free health care, schools and subsidized housing for everyone. But this came at a cost - and some weren't willing to pay the price. So they began leaving the country in the 1960s, and it all came to a head in 1980.
author: web-team@wpr.org (Wisconsin Public Radio)
category: Culture, History, North American History, Justice, Social Issues, Immigration, Latino, Race
